p: The soil nutrients and moisture under the canopy of N. glauca shrub were higher than outside canopy. The invasive species have been reported to change the soil nutrients ( Liao et al., 2008). However, the invasive plants usually exhaust water and nutrient resources more than the native species, hence colonizing new habitats ( Bonanomi et al., 2018, Incerti et al., 2018, Wang et al., 2019).
